description.title: passenger compartment cooling assembly : precautions for the repair

descmetadata.siename: passenger compartment cooling assembly : precautions for the repair

noteR.para: The following must be worn when handling refrigerant:

ul.li: protective glasses (with side shields if possible).

noteR.para: In the event of refrigerant coming into contact with the eyes, rinse thoroughly with clean water for 15 minutes. If possible, have an eye rinse unit available.
If refrigerant should come into contact with the eyes, seek medical assistance immediately. Inform the doctor that the burns were caused by refrigerant fluid type R134A or 1234YF .
If the fluid comes into contact with other unprotected parts of the body (even though the safety rules were followed), rinse thoroughly with clean water for 15 minutes without interruption.
Work requiring the use of refrigerant must be carried out in a well-ventilated area.
The refrigerant must not be stored in a well, a pit, a hermetically sealed room, etc.
Refrigerants are colourless and odourless.

descbody.para: Refrigerant is heavier than air. As a result there is a risk of asphyxia for those working close to the ground and less than 5 m away from the working area (pit, well, air vents, etc.)
Switch on the gas extraction systems.
At temperatures over 100˚C, the refrigerant will decompose and produce a highly irritant gas.

noteR.para: Keep naked flames and anything which may cause fire (sparks, cigarettes, mobile phones, etc.) away from the work area.
Consult the device's operating manual to avoid incorrect use.

descbody.para: It is possible to place components in the drying oven after painting or to carry out work near the system if the temperature does not exceed 80˚C.

noteR.para: To prevent refrigerant from leaking, never repair a faulty air conditioning circuit component.
Replace all faulty components.

descbody.para: It is essential to follow the routing of the connecting pipes.
Ensure that the refrigerant connecting pipes are correctly fitted so that they will not come into contact with metal parts in the engine compartment.

noteR.para: In order to avoid any refrigerant leaks, do not damage (distort, twist, etc.) the pipe.
To avoid damaging the surface of the air conditioning pipes when removing the seals, do not use a tool with a metal end piece.
To prevent moisture from entering the system, place plugs on the cold loop components which are open to the air.
Note:

Use blanking plugs for the fuel circuits with part numbers 77 01 208 229 or 77 01 476 857 to plug any openings exposed to the open air. They must be clean. Do not use any plugs which have already been used to plug a fuel circuit.
Do not remove the blanking plugs from each component until the last moment.
Also, do not remove the components from their packaging until they are to be fitted to the vehicle.
To avoid any leaks, check that the seal and the pipe surface are in good condition. The seal and the surface must be clean and scratch free.
Lubricants are not mutually compatible: always use the type and quantity of oil recommended for each compressor even when topping up, otherwise you could damage the cold loop components.
Always close the oil cans again after use to keep moisture out and never use oil contained in a can that has been open for a long time (viscous appearance).

descbody.para: To avoid destroying the cold loop components and cause electrical leaks on high voltage electric vehicles, use the type and quantity of oil required for each compressor, including when topping up the air conditioning circuit.
The following lubricants are not miscible:

ul.li: PLANETELF PAG 488 for internal combustion engine vehicles,
Sanden SP 10 for internal combustion engine vehicles,

descbody.para: Always close oil cans after each use to prevent moisture from entering.
Do not use oil which is contained in a can with a viscous appearance.
Use a refrigerant charging station adapted to each type of lubricant.
There are automatic or semi-automatic refrigerant charging stations (see garage equipment catalogue) for injecting lubricants without mixing them.
